Posts.Content: I think this would not have been a problem if I hadn't been on crutches so recently. I would have prefered her to have known the lady who went absailing and did aerobatics in a small aircraft. WHAT IS WRONG WITH THIS PREDICTIVE TEXT? As a rough and tumble grandma I am concerned about the sharp elbows but I agree honesty in a simple form is the best policy.
Posts.Title: Talking to grandchilren about poorly on booby.

Posts.Content: I've just been diagnosed. Had BC twelve years ago when my children were in their early 20s. My son serving in Afghanistan. Now I have 3 granddaughters, one,two and three.  I've recently had a bunionectomy and the three year old has been fascinated by it all. Demanding an inspection of my toe at each visit. When she declares " Its getting better" . When I had the biopsy she spotted the plaster,nothing gets past this child. Yesterday she decided to check on its progress. To be honest I'd forgotten shed seen it. So we were both a bit confused?  How do I protect myself from her sharp little elbows and sharp eyes without coming across as an invalid or her patient? I teach so everything else comes as a chance to learn but this makes me nervous
